name: undeliverable
content:
undeliverable adjective
(LETTER)
Add to word list
Add to word list
A letter, parcel, or message that is undeliverable cannot be delivered: There were thousands of undeliverable packages piling up in the sorting office. Emails sent to addresses at these domains were returned as undeliverable.
More examplesFewer examplesIf the postal authorities alert us that your magazine is undeliverable, we have no further obligation unless we receive a corrected address within two years.One reason for the high percentage of undeliverable summonses is that invalid names and addresses have not been removed from the database.I sent the email again and it came back as undeliverable.

undeliverable adjective
(PROMISE)
If something that was promised or planned is undeliverable, it cannot be done: We are stupid, and elect people who make the most undeliverable promises. Several proposals have been put to customers offering undeliverable discounts on call rates, even though the customer is on the best possible rate.
More examplesFewer examplesLabour claimed that the Tory defence plans were undeliverable.Their plans were ruled out as politically undeliverable.The tax guarantee was undeliverable and went to the heart of the contradictions in the government position.
